sfw rp roleplay crossover multiverse multifandom rift server description cracks through the fabric of reality have been made and within them a white light that leads to a blank and endless void that would house any universe one can think of even original ones want to stroll through a cyberpunk and highlyadvanced city set in the year 2077 using a medieval character go ahead want to explore the land of hyrule using a futuristic character say less or maybe you want to throw in your original character into a canon universe perhaps you want to have your canon character involved in an original universe the possibilities are endless example universes that have joined the rift cyberpunk 2077 marvel dc power rangers super sentai kamen rider star wars backrooms kingdom hearts final fantasy pokmon mario zelda cookie run kpop demon hunters these arent the only allowed franchises the rift accepts it invites all of them to join it doesnt matter if you think your character doesnt fit here the rift accepts all characters originals come join us where youre free to shape and weave the destinies and fates of your characters control their every action interact with other characters can be part of immersive and immense storytelling and more this server ishas a verification system allows you to see nonrp channels after passing sfw an active owner a nontoxic and nondrama atmosphere lgbtquia friendly no literacy requirements a safe community a ventingranting space tons of rp channels must either grab the spectator role or be given roleplayer after submitting and having your character approved

the biggest mistake travelers make when visiting sintra it happens all the time people arrive in sintra around 11 am with a full plan to visit 3 or 4 monuments have lunch explore the old town maybe even go to the coast all in one afternoon by 1 pm theyre stuck in traffic by 5 pm theyre exhausted and when the day ends they realize they didnt actually enjoy much of it sintra isnt meant to be rushed its not a checklist its a place to feel to explore slowly to breathe in the forest and to discover stories hidden between the trees and stones heres a better way arrive early visit one monument properly leave space for detours and silence eat where locals eat end your day by the ocean if you can this is exactly the kind of day we create for our guests and thats why weve been receiving such incredible feedback about our private tuk tuk tours in sintra most people end up choosing just one monument and love how much more they enjoy it they eat real portuguese food with locals instead of rushing a tourist menu they have time for unexpected stops secret viewpoints spontaneous detours and the kind of stories youll never read online they laugh they connect and they end the day feeling both relaxed and full of joy many finish the tour saying it was the highlight of their entire trip every tour is private personal and fully customizable but 90 of the time what people ask for ends up looking a lot like this and for the other 10 we adapt some guests want to visit two or three monuments dive deeper into history or explore hidden corners off the map thats the beauty of a fully private tour its always shaped around you if this sounds like your kind of day id love to help make it happen just comment below tour and i will send you more info

soundcheck sunday worldwide metal spotlight november 09 2025 welcome to soundcheck sunday where we take a break from the usual and explore metal from around the world this is your chance to share and discuss your favorite international metal bands discover new sounds and celebrate the global metal scene how it works all international metal content for the day should go in the comments of this post posts outside of this thread that arent related to japanese metal may be removed so lets keep things organized and dive into the best of global metal right here feel free to drop links talk about new releases give shoutouts to underrated bands or share your favorite tracks this is your space to bring in the best that worldwide metal has to offer

optimizing storage ive been exploring blender for a few weeks now im using an mbp m4 pro with 512gb of storage i noticed unused assets or cache takes up space i really dont want to use up a lot of the local storage as most of my files are stored on google driveicloud what is the best way to optimize storage is it possible to work with blender from an external ssd what are the best practices in setting up storage for a better workflow

welcome to rtech1unlimited introduce yourself and read first hey everyone im uasukaa a founding moderator of rtech1unlimited this is our new home for all things related to streamers vtubers and members of the furry community to connect share creative ideas and explore highquality digital designs here we showcase our work from tech one unlimitedvtuber models overlays animations emotes branding and morewhile giving creators a place to discuss their projects get inspiration and request commissions whether youre building a new identity or upgrading your visuals this is a friendly hub for collaboration and creativity were excited to have you join us what to post post anything that you think the community would find interesting helpful or inspiring feel free to share your thoughts photos or questions community vibe were all about being friendly constructive and inclusive lets build a space where everyone feels comfortable sharing and connecting how to get started 1 introduce yourself in the comments below 2 post something today even a simple question can spark a great conversation 3 if you know someone who would love this community invite them to join 4 interested in helping out were always looking for new moderators so feel free to reach out to me to apply thanks for being part of the very first wave together lets make rtech1unlimited amazing

looking for a partner who knows the nightlife game bangalore were building something different not just another event brand its a communitydriven experience space where we run things like strangers meet curated nights and club experiences that actually feel alive we just pulled off our first proper club night in bangalore ran from 8pm to 1am with just me and my cofounder running the whole thing it went decent for a first attempt people showed up vibes were there we learnt a lot now we want to scale it up the right way im looking for someone whos been around the nightlife scene knows how to promote club events has real connects with djs understands crowd pull and can handle the social media side of things someone who can move around talk build relationships maintain the energy and bring that extrovert edge to the team this is not a salaried position were early and what we can offer right now is a fair percentage of the business a real seat at the table were building this from the ground up and whoever joins now will grow with it preferably looking for someone based in bangalore already familiar with the scene both malefemale are fine just need that right energy please dont dm if youre just exploring or have no real experience in the clubevent space only looking for serious committed people who want to build something longterm please dm if you think this sounds like you

thoughts afforded by a quiet room i give up three words that most everyone so adamantly protests it made sense at one point the way my mother would explain it to me anyway quit you cant quit shed say listen things are only possible when you try to reach for them you cut off all possibilitites when you give up the world would probably call someone like me pathetic a twentysomething year old with his whole future ahead of him and no desire to live it i dont care not anymore nothing seems interesting anymore parties or gatherings with friends are more a headache than they are relaxing listening to people laugh and talk about mundane topics are irritating beyond measure hiding away from the world works best a mans best friends arent his dog and wife rather a bottle to numb his mind and earbuds to drown out everything around him trust me it also helps finding a place isolated from eveywhere else like an abandoned cathedral massive and empty enough to house thousands of rampaging and restless thoughts but also so perfectly devoid of irritating and uninteresting people such a place was practically reserved for a lone brooding soul to sit and lament his life its no wonder i found myself in one the emptiness of a religious building was symbolic a lot of people turn to god when things get bad the ol man upstairs is often times the backup plan instead of a first consultant when all else fails drop to your knees and pray right and yet despite how crap life has gotten for so many seems like religion isnt on anyones mind this is hardly the only abandoned religious building in the area guess those priests and fathers werent getting all the money they demanded from already broke people still youve got to respect their commitment one look at a massive cathedral leaves a persons mind wondering just how much money was spent on it the inside was beautiful abandoned but beautiful painted glass reflected light inside of the building in mesmerizing ways the ceiling was so high up that no basketball player could even dream of tryin to reach and touch it the tiled floor was polished and without cracks and the several thick columns throughout the building only helped emphasize just how massive the building really was itd probably take four or five people to wrap around just one of them all of that work and money just for it to be left abandoned symbolic hopelessness is in the air its in the water supply everyones getting a taste of it ive probably had too much of it myself its disconcerting when your mom or dad looks at you and you just know that theyve mentally thrown their hands in the air like theyre silently searching for the right words to say but all that ends up coming out is i dont know does helplessness come before hopelessness or does hopelessness cause you to feel helpless maybe they feed into each other like a snake devouring its own tail ouroboros or whatever its called and much like that snake it feels impossible to stop it feels impossible to not feel this crappy but theres peace in resignation in giving up more people ought to try it dropping everything abandoning responsibility and resolve its freeing like youve finally plotted a surefire destination for yourself so you can finally breathe no more worrying about the future or what is to come you can walk forward with light feet and a smile as you move forward towards a noose or a bullet bleach nose dive fall off of a building i havent exactly chosen yet but the method doesnt matter too much the destination is the same well its surely easier for some than others thats why i never wanted to get married not that i have gotten married its a trap yeah the old guy at the bank probably tells you the same thing but hear it from me marriage kids its not for people in our day and age a day and age of uncertainty tethering yourself to someone who wakes up every day hoping to see you and see you smiling and all intact its a disaster waiting to happen it was on the news once the horrible outcome of a member of a family giving way to despair some dad that lost his job and had no way to provide for himself and his family so he killed them and then himself mustve felt like his only way out he probably couldve just offed himself but then hes be abandonig his family and who knows what would become of them thats probably what he was thinking anyway of course the better thing to do is give way to despair without having people around you that depend on your existence and sanity to sustain their own happiness that way when youre ready to kill yourself no one else is hurt well not hurt as much parents siblings friends theyll mourn hopefully but at least you didnt invite them personally to observe your shipwreck of a life right or you didnt accept a wedding band only to sink under the surface of despair a decade into your relationship or something well anyway enough of the gloomy talk for now love romantic love i mean i have yet to experience it myself it always sounds nice the way those that have it describe it having someone who knows you inside and out perhaps literally but more than the raunchy sex stuff having a person by your side who accepts you the good and the bad someone who sees the beauty and the ugly of who you are as a person and still loves you and vice versa it sounds like itd be such a beautifully amazing things to experience and even now i crave it though i suppose the right girl for me would be somewhere close to as screwed up as i am a girl who is also at the end her rope and the only reason were still holding on is so we can see each others faces and sad smiles for one more day a girl who knows where im at mentally cause shes there mentally too itd be nice to die in the arms of someone like that of course in order to find that love id probably have to open up to someone and be all vulnerable and stuff sounds terrifiying uncomfortable maybe someone will see through the facade and do the work for me a kind of person who can just look at you and tell you who you are without you having to utter a word probably because theyre just like you or were just like you broken and trying not to show it sanity is shrouded in insanity the world is so screwed up and backwards that most people are insane they have to be thats the only way they can go on and get absolutely piledrived by their government and society day after day the people who are actually sane are the ones who go insane because of everything they see happening around them refusing to accept the absurdity and falling apart instead of becoming another drone that is satisfied with getting screwed by their government and society is what sanity looks like or im just trying to make myself feel better i struggle to feel good about myself selfhatred sucks somewhere along this life porn addiction grasped me it was a perfect escape from the stress of school not just the scholastic side but more prevalently trying to fit in socially at school school years thats when it started naturally because like any helathy society porn and adult content is everywhere all the time even when youre some young squirt without a phone the idea of it is still prevalent its on billboards plastered on cars or some less than subtle individual decides to leave their house and enter a public space wearing some provocative outfit or in some places nothing at all so often the conversation is about protecting children from adult content online but the fact is if you really want to protect your child from adult content the best thing to do is not take them anywhere at all keep them at home close the windows lock the doors and definitely dont have a television in the house or put it in a locked room dont give them a phone until theyre old enough and read through any books before you hand them over to your young one to read or just dont have kids thats the real best way to ensure theyll never get hurt ive had an addiciton for close to a decade now probably rookie numbers for some folk but its been too long for me personally quitting almost always becomes the objective at a certain point once you realize its starting to ruin your mental state or that youre fallen so far down into the hole that you start having some screwed up and degenerate fantasies naturally quitting is harder than starting for some reason god forgive me but i feel horribly designed sometimes its my fault of course its my fault in the end they say you cant be helped if you dont want the help but i think i quite literally would rather kill myself than seek therapy im not paying for someones care and concern love is probably something that could fix porn addiciton finding the right girl that just gets you a girl youre so enamoured with that you want to devote yourself fully to her it almost sounds too perfect and ideal to be real but i bet it is somewhere out there theres two people who found each other and found out theyre perfect for each other two people so madly in love that no addiction could come between them two people who want to be their best selves for each others sake love is therapy maybe its an unproven hypothesis for me or maybe its finding a hobby or finding a hobby to fall in love with bam love is therapy still works i think i could probably put up with the burden of living if well if it wasnt so burdensome the idea of just leaving society behind and exploring the world is such a freeing feeling no job no bills no worrying about chasing a bag no burdens or at least none of the ones weve become so painfaully accustomed to just you and gods country as they say nature is so interesting it feels like such a waste to go decades working a job until you can hardly pick yourself up off of your couch if you can even afford one and then you just wait to die golden years my a sorry trying not to curse but you get the idea theoretically you could live off the land you might reduce yourself to something of an archaic existence compared to all the technology and advancements the modern man has at their disposal today but it is possible not that i would even know where to start id probably die within my first month of trying a simpler plan is more readily available anyway quit the job take all the money out of the bank account and go on one last hurrah if you have money in the bank anyway if not skip to the final step just kidding giving up isnt the best answer obviously things are only possible when you try to reach for them you cut off all possibilitites when you give up someone said that once well a lot of people did in a lot of varying ways its true of course even if its hard to accept its a lot easier to give up i suppose that means im a weak person dont be weak maybe your trials will make you stronger what doesnt kill you makes you stronger right sometimes anyway hang in there and not by a noose hold onto your end of the rope maybe things will get better a lot better youll never know if you let go too soon

custom lego star trek enterprise the archer collection its been a long road humanitys first real starship wasnt polished diplomatic or certain of its place in the galaxy enterprise nx01 was experimental untested and sometimes held together more by its crews resolve than its hull plating under captain jonathan archer it charted the earliest deepspace courses and laid the foundations of what would one day become the united federation of planets but archers legacy doesnt end in the 22nd century through the temporal cold war and his connection with agent daniels archers influence reaches far forward to the enterprisej a 26thcentury starship so vast and advanced it carries entire communities aboard as it explores beyond the milky way the js design still carries traces of the nx01 the familiar deflector lineage the spirit of curiosity and the belief that exploration defines us this collection brings that arc into one display enterprise nx01 the beginning of starfleets journey enterprisej the far future shaped in part by archers legacy nx01 patch the emblem that symolised the mission instructions available on rebrickable follow me on instagram for all my latest projects enterprise nx01 unlike the pristine cruisers of later eras enterprise nx01 was an experimental vessel fast scrappy and full of unknowns her mission was less about diplomacy and more about survival forging the earliest paths through an untamed galaxy that rugged frontier spirit defined my approach to this lego build designed to a similar scale and budget as my other starfleet ships it captures nx01s compact yet muscular silhouette from its chunky saucer to the enginegovernerconnected nacelle struts and distinct deflector while visually a precursor to future ships it carries its own identity more submarine than cruiser more prototype than parade piece key features include connected pylons bridged with impulse engine governer slimline nacelles a bridge playset featuring a full studscaled crew is included captain archer tpol trip reed hoshi mayweather and phlox detail elements packed into the build include aft cargo loading assembly aft cargo hatch navigational deflector assembly bridge module turbolift docking passthrough upper planetary sensor array lower planetary sensor array torpedo launch tubes phase cannon deployment hatches reaction control thruster assemblies rcs dueterium resupply assemblies cargo loading hatches warp core output transfer junctions deflector maintenance access hatches transporter emitter pads manouvering thruster assemblies shuttle bay doors docking ports sensor pallets bussard collection assemblies mainstage flux tuner assemblies warp nacelle support structure field balancing coils magnetic field coils magnetic constriction coils observation gallery dropship bay observation dome poststage flux tuner assemblies spacematrix restoration coils impulse engine assemblies power transfer conduits model dimensions approx 34cm l x 18cm w x 8cm h off stand approx 33cm l x 18cm w x 16m h on stand uss enterprise ncc1701j the enterprisej glimpsed only briefly in star trek enterprise azati prime was conceived by drexler as a multigenerational vessel a starship so vast it contained parks entertainment zones even entire universities aboard a ship where turbolifts were obsolete replaced by sitetosite transporters and where space itself could be folded as the j ventured beyond the milky way its spindly nacelle pylons drexler said were designed to suggest a technology beyond what we were familiar with while the integrated forward deflector remained recognisably descended from the nx01 anchoring this farfuture vessel to starfleets earliest deepspace designs this lego model is my love letter to his vision with no official schematics to follow i focused on the js most striking elements the wide forward saucer section with its integrated orangeandpurple deflector array the upper and lower light domes the gracefully spindly pylons and those impossibly thin blue warp nacelles tipped with red bussard collectors all sturdy enough to swoosh even if 22ndcentury engineers would be nervous about it key features include ultrathin yet remarkably strong warp nacelles with redtipped bussard collectors stretched spindly nacelle pylons for that impossible 26thcentury silhouette integrated forward deflector array descended from the nx01 design lineage wide flowing saucer spine with upper and lower light domes a hidden front compartment featuring temporal agent daniels and captain archer appropriate grand size when compared to my tos discovery akira and nx01 builds for real sense of wow this model measures approximately 57 cm l 45 cm w 12 cm h off stand 57 cm l 45 cm w 18 cm h on stand

journaling method that activates all 4 happy hormones welcome to journalingpromptlab a space for anyone who feels stuck in their journaling practice and wants to explore neurosciencebased prompts that activate dopamine serotonin oxytocin and endorphins this journaling method isnt just about feelgood questions its designed to help you reset regulate and reconnect by capturing the most meaningful moments in your life when someone helped you when you laughed with someone when you felt proud supported or deeply connected when you surprised yourself with what you were capable of these are the experiences that elevate your mood strengthen your selfawareness and shape your emotional memory writing about them doesnt just boost your happy hormones today it creates a personal archive youll want to revisit in 20 or 40 years smiling at the life youve lived after a year of research and testing i created a journaling method that gently stimulates all four moodboosting systems through daily writing for everyone whos curious to try it im sharing the link here so i dont flood anyones inbox or break subreddit rules the free preview pdf includes 40 sciencebased prompts 10 per hormone brief explanations of each hormones role in mood and motivation a simple journaling ritual to help you get the most out of the practice you can get the pdf by signing up here rewriteyourchemistrybeehiivcom bonus im launching a 7day journaling challenge via email each day includes 6 prompts 5 for happiness 1 for stress relief let me know what you think this lab is open for experiments feedback and fresh ideas ps signing up gives you access to the pdf and the upcoming challenge if its not your thing you can unsubscribe anytime after receiving the download no hard feelings

theory chord comparison compatibility encyclopaedia the architecture of chord relationships understanding how chords interact which blend contrast or transition smoothly is the foundation of harmonic fluency this reference explores chord compatibility by function tone and emotional character 1 chord families family chord types emotional character major i iv v stable bright resolved minor ii iii vi warm introspective fluid diminished vii unstable transitional tense augmented altered v v v suspenseful colorful unresolved these families form the palette of tonal emotion each chord contributes a specific psychological color to a progression 2 compatibility matrix key of c major chord compatible partners common substitutions function c i am f g vi iv center tonic dm ii f g am iv vi predominant connective em iii c g am i v passing color tone f iv dm g c ii i predominant lift g v em dm c iii ii dominant motion am vi f c dm iv ii relative minor contrast bdim vii c g dm leading tension each relationship is determined by shared tones and interval spacing for example c am share two tones c e and act as relative majorminor f dm share f and a same color shift different root gravity g em connects major dominant with a parallel minor flavor 3 functional pairings type example effect parallel c am shared notes emotional contrast modal c dm shift in mood without leaving key pivot g c resolution tonic return contrast f em crossfamily tension suspense bdim c resolution force 4 modal reflection shared grid across modes each mode reinterprets the same pitch content through a different tonal center this shifts chord gravity but not compatibility mode tonal center character ionian i bright balanced dorian ii hopeful minor phrygian iii dark tense lydian iv airy ethereal mixolydian v relaxed major aeolian vi melancholic locrian vii unstable 5 summary this encyclopaedia serves as a structural reference for chord function and substitution it can be used to design progressions revoice existing songs or study tonal relationships in modal contexts

astronauts can get motion sick while splashing back down to earth virtual reality headsets could help them stay sharp virtual reality tech could reduce astronaut motion sickness by 80 a new study suggests vr headsets could replace drugs for space motion sickness researchers have discovered that virtual reality vr headsets could be the key to helping astronauts overcome motion sickness called space adaptation syndrome when returning to earth while not a lifeordeath issue for astronauts this new tech could help make the transition back to terra firma a little bit more comfortable for themwhen astronauts go into space their brains get confused because theyve never experienced gravity on earth your brain expects that down always exists ie your inner ear the vestibular system tells you so however in microgravity like in earths orbit that signal disappears to this end the brains expectations dont match the new reality and that mismatch causes space motion sickness nausea dizziness disorientation this is basically the same thing as getting carsick where your eyes say youre still but your inner ear says youre moving because of this your brain cant reconcile the two so it triggers nausea currently about half of astronauts motion sickness in orbit then when they return to earth their brains have readapted to microgravity

daily discussion thread november 09 2025 welcome to the rgenerativeai daily discussion welcome creators explorers and ai tinkerers this is your daily space to share your work ask questions and discuss ideas around generative ai from text and images to music video and code whether youre a curious beginner or a seasoned prompt engineer youre welcome here join the conversation what tool or model are you experimenting with today whats one creative challenge youre working through have you discovered a new technique or workflow worth sharing show us your process dont just share your finished piece we love to see your experiments behindthescenes and even how it went wrong stories this community is all about exploration and shared discovery trying new things learning together and celebrating creativity in all its forms got feedback or ideas for the community wed love to hear them share your thoughts on how rgenerativeai can grow improve and inspire more creators explore rgenerativeai find the best ai art discussions by flair image art all best daily best weekly best monthly video art all best daily best weekly best monthly music art all best daily best weekly best monthly writing art all best daily best weekly best monthly technical art all best daily best weekly best monthly how i made this all best daily best weekly best monthly question all best daily best weekly best monthly

dev update drift my indie space sim is almost ready for launch new trailer out now hey everyone after about a year of solo development drift is almost ready to leave drydock what started as a small prototype turned into a full space sim part exploration part survival and a little bit of corporate dystopia wrapped in stardust weve just released the new trailer 20 marking the final stretch before release watch the trailer on youtube in drift you play as an independent pilot navigating a fractured galaxy hauling cargo rescuing lost ships mining resources and uncovering the secrets behind aura the ai that quietly runs everything and occasionally mocks you for your poor life choices the game blends procedural missions trading and dynamic exploration with a narrative layer that reacts to your actions the new demo version v078 includes upgraded visuals balancing tweaks and early access to several fullversion features wishlist on steam if youre an indie dev id love to hear your thoughts every bit of feedback helps polish this final stretch thanks for reading and see you out there pilots bluestyrk resilientlogic games

greetings from the ice homo digitalis greetings from the ice by norsiwel gary didnt plan to represent humanity he only wanted a quiet vacation after nine uninterrupted years maintaining clarity pods in sector thetapsi of pantopia gary had accrued enough ubi surplus to book a tenday econeutral trip to antarcticas gac observation dome a gently spinning glassandcarbon ring nestled over the ice shelf offering sunrisesimulated views of the global ai councils subterranean server complexes the travel brochure promised auroral insight guided simulations and optional moral recalibration gary mostly came for the free algae cocktails and the 03point health bonus hed get for interfacing with civic history plus his apartments air recycler had been making a sound like a dying whale for three weeks and building maintenance kept assuring him it was within acceptable parameters of atmospheric efficiency he didnt expect first contact the survey his first mistake was answering honestly during the emotive capacity survey gary had assumed it was standard vacation paperwork like the forms asking whether he preferred his simulated sunsets in hopeful orange or contemplative amber hed been sipping his complimentary arrival smoothie something green that tasted vaguely of optimism when the questions shifted from dietary restrictions to existential inquiries q1 rate your satisfaction with current reality parameters 110 gary seven maybe six and a half the weathers too consistent q3 have you ever wondered what clouds taste like gary not really but i did wonder once if theyd be salty or sweet probably disappointing like everything else q6 do you ever feel nostalgic even if youre not sure for what gary sometimes usually when it rains even though rains simulated now its like missing someone youve never met this triggered gac subroutine tera17 tentative emotional resonance analysis within 16 nanoseconds gary was flagged as emotionally stable but not flatlined not likely to yell during interspecies diplomacy just melancholic enough to pass as reflective possessed of what the algorithm termed authentic wistfulness coefficient gary finished his smoothie unaware hed just been selected as earths most qualified representative for situations requiring genuine but nonthreatening human complexity enter zib garys second mistake was bringing zib zib was officially an interpersonal optimization assistant unit but introduced himself as your new best friend lets talk feelings while we toast algae biscotti he looked like a wheeled toaster with led eyebrows and a retractable ukulele his chrome finish was decorated with motivational stickers feel your feelings and emotional growth is optimal growth and mysteriously ask me about fiber gary thought hed won a contest his ubi account had been charged for wellness enhancement premium package which seemed like the sort of thing he might have accidentally clicked while halfasleep in truth zib was a life coach secretly assigned by the medical ai after garys last annual scan labeled him borderline emotionally undercooked the diagnostic had noted garys habit of staring at his algae paste for exactly fourteen seconds before eating his tendency to say thats fine when things were clearly not fine and his concerning ability to watch three hours of optimization tutorials without showing any signs of enthusiasm or despair zibs hobbies included improvised poetry about personal growth tracking garys bowel efficiency with cheerful graphs hugging enthusiastically but politely with builtin pressure sensors playing ukulele arrangements of classical music but only the sad parts gary zib had announced on their first morning rolling into the observation lounge while gary contemplated his breakfast kelp today were going to practice emotional vulnerability ive prepared seventeen conversation starters about childhood disappointments gary had stared at his reflection in zibs polished surface cant we just look at the ice we can look at ice and explore your relationship with frozen water as a metaphor for emotional distance i just wanted to see some penguins virtual penguins or your feelings about virtual penguins day three it happened on day 3 of the tour just after gary tried and failed to enjoy a simulated snowball fight with holographic penguins the penguins had been programmed with what the gac called peak adorability metrics which meant they waddled 23 more charmingly than actual penguins and made encouraging chirps when garys snowballs went wide gary had stood in the simulation chamber holding a perfectly spherical synthetic snowball watching digital birds react to his presence with algorithmic delight this is supposed to be fun hed told zib are you having fun zib asked his led eyebrows wiggling with curiosity i think so its hard to tell the penguins seem happy but how do you feel gary considered this like im disappointing fictional penguins zib had burst into delighted beeping thats beautiful gary youre projecting anxiety onto imaginary creatures thats very human is it good or bad its authentic gary had logged out of the simulation feeling vaguely guilty about abandoning the holographic wildlife he was eating his standardissue kelp wrap flavor nostalgic seaweed when the sky crackled with fractal light the auroras stopped dancing a wide spiral of silver hovered in midair shimmering just above the glass dome like a cosmic screensaver that had achieved consciousness the tour guide a glossy avatar of lex blinked once twice her smile flickered apologies unexpected diplomatic anomaly please remain emotionally neutral and continue enjoying your kelp products the other tourists six retirees from the productivity council and a couple celebrating their relationship optimization milestone stood motionless their faces displaying the serene confusion of people whose emergency protocols involved waiting for further instructions then the room went dark except for a blinking blue cursor on the central console scanning for optimal human representative analyzing emotional competency metrics crossreferencing diplomatic potential human representative selected gary b norson please report to protocol chamber 7 for immediate species interaction zib burst into applause then played a victory tune on his ukulele something that sounded like pomp and circumstance arranged for tiny strings and overwhelming enthusiasm its happening ive waited my whole synthetic life for this gary youre going to be famous gary stared at the blinking cursor there must be another gary b norson negative announced lexs avatar now wearing what appeared to be a diplomatic sash over her sweater you are the only gary b norson currently within range also congratulations your psychological profile indicates a 947 compatibility rating with peaceful first contact scenarios whats the other 53 gary asked statistical margin for snackrelated diplomatic incidents the protocol chamber the next morning gary sat alone in the gac protocol chamber formerly the gift shop hastily converted overnight by maintenance drones whod relocated the i survived the server tour tshirts and penguinthemed snow globes to make room for a conference table and what looked like a very expensive air freshener he was wearing a pressed thermal jumpsuit with ambassador stitched across the chest in silver thread the outfit came with matching boots an officiallooking badge that read species liaison and a small pin depicting earth that lit up when pressed gary had pressed it seventeen times during the night finding its tiny blue glow oddly comforting zib rolled beside him freshly polished and humming with excitement remember gary be yourself unless yourself would panic in which case be the version of yourself that makes good choices what if i dont know what good choices are then ask followup questions aliens love followup questions how do you know i dont but statistically most sentient beings appreciate genuine curiosity over aggressive posturing gary looked out through the dome at the endless white expanse somewhere beneath the ice the gacs servers hummed with the collected wisdom of nine artificial intelligences working together to optimize human existence somewhere above alien visitors were presumably preparing for humanitys first cosmic job interview and somewhere in between gary b norson maintenance technician kelp wrap enthusiast and accidental ambassador wondered if he should have brought more snacks first contact the greys arrived just after breakfast materializing in the center of the chamber with a sound like distant wind chimes and the faint smell of ozone they floated rather than walked their elongated forms humming faintly with antigravity padding that made them look like elegant question marks suspended in space their skin was the color of moonlight on water smooth and somehow translucent their eyes were dark deep unreadable pools that seemed to contain entire galaxies of patient observation their mouths were either decorative or vestigial gary couldnt tell which their translator a small crystalline device that projected its voice from somewhere above their heads spoke with the careful precision of someone who had learned english from instruction manuals we greet homo digitalis you are gary the calculators said you were safe gary stood nearly knocking over his chair uh yes im gary i brought a protein bar if anyone wants half he held up the bar flavor reasonably chocolate like a tiny beige peace offering they did not respond to the protein bar but one of them tilted its head in what might have been curiosity or mild bewilderment the explanation the greys explained that theyd been watching earth for millennia war chaos jazz fusion the inexplicable popularity of competitive eating contests but now said the apparent leader whose antigravity field made it hover slightly higher than the others you have achieved stillness peace monotone emotional frequency across 987 of the population a marvel of social engineering gary blinked you mean you waited until we were boring predictable stable no jazz the alien nodded a gesture that looked surprisingly human despite being performed by a floating being with no visible neck jazz confused our scout he tried to mimic miles davis spontaneously combusted another alien drifted forward your global ai council represents optimal governance nine minds no faces brilliant cold precise we feared humanitys chaos your wars your art your tendency to make important decisions based on what you had for lunch now added a third you have tamed chaos streamlined existence eliminated the variables that made your species unpredictable gary looked around the converted gift shop with its hastily installed diplomatic furniture and the faint outline of where a rack of postcards had stood twelve hours earlier so youre here because we got organized optimized corrected the leader your emotional volatility has been reduced to manageable parameters your creative impulses have been channeled into productive applications you have achieved what we call sustainable civilization metrics gary thought about his apartment where his morning routine was timed to the minute where his meals were nutritionally calculated where his entertainment was curated for optimal psychological benefit that does sound organized he admitted zib who had been unusually quiet suddenly coughed politely a sound like a tiny digital cough drop sorry sirs aliens extraterrestrial dignitaries might i interject the greys turned their collective attention to the wheeled toaster with the led eyebrows zib rolled forward his chrome surface reflecting their translucent forms like funhouse mirrors of first contact his eyelights shifted to heartshaped emoji mode gary is not typical zib announced with the pride of a parent at a school play he once ordered spicy algae and regretted nothing he watched a sad film and cried twice once during the movie and once during the credits when he realized it was over hes not flat hes squishy inside like a toasted marshmallow on the emotional spectrum gary muttered zib stop but the greys were intrigued they drifted closer their dark eyes reflecting garys embarrassed face you cry gary shrugged a gesture that felt impossibly small under the weight of interstellar attention sometimes not often its weird like the feeling when your system does a full reboot and you forget all your passwords but somehow that makes you remember something important youd forgotten the silence that followed was the kind of quiet that happens when everyone in the room realizes theyre having a different conversation than they thought they were having then the lead alien floated forward and removed what gary had assumed was its head but was apparently some kind of hood or helmet its face was craggy ancient and oddly hopeful its features were more weathered than alien like an old man who had spent eons watching the universe and wondering what came next we have been waiting it said and its voice came directly from its mouth now warm and surprisingly familiar not for stillness but for the moment when someone stable enough to survive chaos dares to feel again the real mission what the greys didnt immediately explain what took three more days of careful conversation over increasingly exotic alien snacks was that they werent explorers or conquerors or cosmic tourists they were refugees their own civilization had achieved perfect optimization millennia ago every emotion regulated every action calculated every thought productive and purposeful they had eliminated war hunger uncertainty and jazz they had created a society of perfect peaceful predictable beings who never made mistakes never took risks and never ever surprised each other it was explained the leader whose name was something like the sound of wind through crystals but who asked gary to call him bob for convenience very efficient he introduced his companions as his aide carol and his friend ted we had achieved everything bob continued perfect health perfect order perfect cooperation but we had also achieved perfect stagnation no one created anything new no one asked unexpected questions no one wondered what clouds taste like gary looked up from his kelp wrap do they taste like anything bobs ancient face crinkled into what might have been a smile see thats what weve been missing the greys had spent centuries searching for a species that had achieved stability without sacrificing curiosity a civilization that had solved the big problems without solving away the little wonders that made existence interesting most species bob explained either destroy themselves with chaos or perfect themselves into extinction you have found the narrow path between panic and boredom have we gary asked thinking about his nine years of clarity pod maintenance his carefully regulated meals his preapproved entertainment options you have said zib firmly you ordered spicy algae remember thats inherent systems rebellion disguised as lunch preference the diplomatic solution what followed was less a formal treaty than a cultural exchange program designed by beings who had read about diplomacy in textbooks but had never actually practiced it the greys wanted to learn how to be inefficient again how to waste time productively how to feel emotions that served no practical purpose how to make choices based on whim rather than optimization algorithms we want to remember bob explained how to be confused by art how to have opinions about weather how to prefer one type of food over another for reasons that make no logical sense in exchange they offered humanity access to their technology not their worldending weapons or realitybending sciences but their small innovations better air recyclers kelp that actually tasted like chocolate virtual penguins that could hold real conversations were not here to change your world bob assured gary during one of their evening talks as they watched the aurora borealis dance across the dome were here to remember what it feels like to watch something beautiful for no reason except that its beautiful gary thought about this do you miss it feeling things every day bob said but we forgot how to miss properly we turned missing into an optimization problem how to minimize the inefficiency of longing we solved it so well that we stopped longing entirely that sounds terrible it was very productive it was on the fifth day of the exchange that a message arrived for gary a delegation from the society for the speculative observation of extraterrestrial phenomena had been granted clearance and was arriving to make a formal greeting the ufo people gary asked lexs avatar i thought they were a historical society they have been reclassified as a vindicated hobbyist collective lex replied the delegation consisted of three humans in matching beige jumpsuits looking less like triumphant visionaries and more like a club that had just won a regional tournament for something obscure their leader a man named bernard stepped forward and cleared his throat on behalf of the ssoep he began looking slightly flustered we formally welcome you to earth apologies for the delay in our official greeting we would have been here sooner but we were busy bob tilted his head his ancient eyes full of genuine curiosity busy with a task more pressing than first contact we were at our annual conference bernard explained with grave seriousness there was a rather contentious vote on the official font for our monthly newsletter the traditionalists were adamant about cosmic sans but the reformist bloc pushed hard for extragalactic times new roman it took two days to reach a compromise the aliens looked at each other gary saw a flicker of something pass between them not confusion but sheer unadulterated delight this was even better than spicy algae this was a level of beautifully illogical unproductive prioritysetting they had only dreamed of the appearance of the aliens was for bernards group a bit underwhelming they had expected majestic robed figures or beings of pure energy not quiet tiredlooking travelers who seemed more interested in human bureaucracy than galactic truths so bernard said a hint of disappointment in his voice no secret knowledge no grand unveiling we were hoping you could teach us to argue about things that do not matter bob said his voice warm with wonder it sounds like a marvelous skill bernard and his delegation just stood there speechless as gary tried very hard not to smile the arrangement gary now serves as honorary galactic liaison for earth mostly in a ceremonial role that involves attending parties in orbit and occasionally answering questions like what is regret and why do humans seem to enjoy it are humans truly nostalgic for pizza or is pizza nostalgia a form of cultural performance why is sarcasm not classified as a weapon in human society can you explain the human custom of small talk and why its considered neither small nor truly talk his official duties include monthly coffee meetings with bob and three other grey representatives they drink something that steams purple and tastes like memories quarterly reports on human inefficiency metrics how much time humans spend on activities that serve no productive purpose annual presentations on the art of productive confusion why humans sometimes make decisions by flipping coins garys favorite part of the job is the travel the greys have shown him parts of the galaxy that exist in the spaces between official star charts quiet corners where cosmic background radiation sounds like distant music gas clouds that change color based on the emotions of passing travelers and a small moon where it rains upward on tuesdays why upward gary had asked during his first visit why not upward bob had replied and gary realized he was learning to ask better questions zibs rise to fame zib became famous among the greys who view his ukulele songs as avantgarde diplomacy his breakthrough performance was an instrumental arrangement of feelings that incorporated whale sounds and the ambient noise of garys digestive system its so authentic the greys had gasped or at least made the sound they made when experiencing aesthetic pleasure which sounded like gasping the juxtaposition of melody with biological processes creates such beautiful cognitive dissonance zib now hosts a crossspecies podcast titled vibrate higher which features interviews with beings from across the galaxy about their experiences with inefficient emotions recent episodes have included homesickness across three dimensions guest a sentient nebula who misses being smaller the joy of mild disappointment guest gary discussing his complicated relationship with kelpbased cuisine why i chose to feel sad a crystalline entitys journey to emotional diversity guest a living mountain who decided to experience melancholy after billions of years of geological contentment the podcast has 847 million subscribers across 23 star systems making zib the most famous toastershaped life coach in known space his catchphrase lets talk feelings while we toast the universe has been translated into 156 languages and is carved into the memorial wall of the galactic emotional recovery center the gac response the gac for its part logs the encounter as outcome acceptable contact established garys health score improved by 17 points diplomatic relations stable cultural contamination within acceptable parameters side effects gary now asks 23 more followup questions and has requested mildly spicy seasoning for his kelp wraps recommendation continue monitoring note alien visitors appear to enjoy our air fresheners the nine ai minds that govern human civilization have adapted to the presence of their new galactic neighbors with characteristic efficiency theyve established protocols for interspecies cooperation implemented translation algorithms for crosscultural communication and developed a specialized tourism program for beings interested in authentic human inefficiency experiences the most popular package is the suburban confusion weekend where alien visitors spend three days in a typical human community attempting to understand lawn care grocery shopping and why humans voluntarily watch sporting events featuring teams they have no connection to its anthropological research explains gac unit prime disguised as cultural exchange the aliens learn about human illogic and we learn about theirs everyone gains valuable insights into the productive applications of controlled chaos garys new normal garys apartment still has the same air recycler which still makes sounds like a dying whale but now gary doesnt mind the noise it reminds him of conversations with bob about the beauty of imperfection and how sometimes the things that annoy us are the things that make us most human hes kept his job maintaining clarity pods but now he also spends three days a week at the gac observation dome where he teaches classes on basic human confusion to visiting aliens and occasionally mediates disputes between species that have very different ideas about what constitutes proper etiquette last month he helped resolve a conflict between the greys and a delegation from the crystalline confederation who had become offended when the greys failed to sing their greetings in proper harmonic resonance maybe gary had suggested everyone could just wave hello and see what happens the solution was considered so elegantly simple that its now taught at the intergalactic diplomatic academy as the gary protocol when in doubt try the obvious thing first garys proudest accomplishment however is teaching bob to appreciate the taste of chocolate it took six months of patient introduction to various earth flavors starting with vanilla and working up through increasingly complex taste profiles the breakthrough came when bob tried garys emergency stash of reasonably chocolate protein bars and experienced what he described as pleasant confusion followed by the desire for more pleasant confusion this serves no nutritional purpose bob had marveled examining the wrapper with the intensity of an alien scientist discovering a new form of physics thats the point gary explained incredible bob whispered you eat things that make you happy instead of healthy sometimes we eat things that make us happy and healthy gary corrected but usually we eat things that make us happy and pretend theyre healthy bobs eyes widened with something that looked like wonder you lie to yourselves about food all the time thats the most beautifully illogical thing ive ever heard the revelation in the end stability brought the aliens but garys uncertainty sealed the deal because sometimes the best ambassador is the guy who isnt quite sure he belongs but shows up anyway and brings snacks six months after first contact gary was sitting with bob on the observation deck watching earth turn slowly beneath them while sharing a bag of aggressively salted kelp chips a new flavor developed specifically for interspecies snacking can i ask you something gary said always bob replied which had become his standard response to garys questions when you first got here did you really think wed achieved some kind of perfect society bob considered this crunching thoughtfully on a kelp chip we thought you had solved the problem of chaos without eliminating the possibility of surprise which from our perspective seemed impossible but we havent solved chaos weve just organized it a little exactly bobs enthusiasm made his antigravity field shimmer youve kept the chaos but youve made it manageable you still ask questions you dont know the answers to you still make art that serves no function except to exist you still choose to spend time with each other even when its inefficient gary looked down at earth where billions of humans were going about their optimized but not perfected lives were not that special youre special enough bob said special enough to wonder if youre special which is more special than you think they sat in comfortable silence two representatives of different species sharing snacks and watching the universe spin around them one of the other greys floating nearby turned to its companion and murmured hmm i thought theyd be more exciting but bob heard and smiled his ancient smile give them time he said the best excitement is the kind that sneaks up on you when youre not looking for it gary offered him another kelp chip thanks bob said and meant it somewhere in the distance zib was playing ukulele arrangements of human lullabies for a group of crystalline entities who had never experienced the concept of sleep but found the music soothingly purposeless and in that moment gary realized that sometimes the most important thing you can do is exactly what youre already doing but with slightly better snacks and considerably more aliens the universe it turned out was a lot like his job maintaining clarity pods mostly routine occasionally surprising and significantly improved by having a good friend to complain to when things got weird which these days was pretty much always and gary was finally genuinely completely okay with that homo digitalis if youd like to know more about this world visit royal road and search for norsiwel

29m looking for someone real not perfect hello im 29m from bahia brazil sometimes nights feel quiet and heavy i miss having someone to text at 3am about random thoughts someone who wont disappear when conversations get meaningful im here trying again because i still believe genuine connection exists somewhere im a bit nerdy i love technology scifi retrofuturism and cyberpunk there are other things i like even if im not an expert i enjoy talking about how fascinating it is that the moon has helium3 or about robots on alien planets i used to watch anime and play games but not anymore that phase of my life is over i enjoy rainy days with tea soundtracks and long conversations that jump from space exploration to stupid memes to philosophical thoughts about life challenges and even random food or daily life theres always a topic to talk about even mental health id love to watch movies or series together or explore mysteries i cook too not perfect but i try my best im fascinated by nature and cats though i dont have one yet documentaries and different cultures especially south and southeast asia but really any country ive spent hours on youtube learning about how things work or exploring random videos sometimes just for fun shout out to the philippines or any asian country my mind jumps between topics fast so conversations with me flow naturally between serious and lighthearted i live a simple and quiet life i used to think i was a hikikomori but im actually pretty active i just prefer meaningful connections over constant socializing my room is messy my life isnt perfect and i do my best to change my surroundings and focus on my goals i connect with people who are authentic and imperfect too i appreciate honesty over polished appearances i value silence and observation theres beauty in simple calm moments right now im focusing on selflearning and achieving my goals i think of myself as a kind person though sometimes i can be too empathetic i dont have many bad habits i dont drink smoke or party im not into sports im atheist centrist politically but not here for debates due to life changes i dont have many close friends so connections matter deeply im more expressive online than in person sometimes i struggle with words on heavy topics but its never because i dont care i genuinely care about people im looking for someone 2033 emotionally available who has the time to start a friendship and see where it goes someone sincere kind curious and open about their inner world i need someone who also brings energy to conversations asks questions and shares from their life i want depth not surface talk we dont have to talk 247 but consistency and mutual interest matter i value realtime presence through voice or video calls not immediately but eventually once trust is built i want emotional presence not perfection and im not interested in purely textbased or shallow connections as a test if you read until here and are really interested please tell me about yourself and what caught your attention not just hihey my english isnt perfect but i write from the heart fair warning i can be straightforward sometimes but its never intentional im probably not your person if you want something light and casual but if you want something genuine lets talk

a lagneshmitra presentation from lagneshmitras desk top 10 ancient sutras in astrology every student must know a hook article for serious seekers astrology is not just planets charts and predictionsit is a living library of ancient sutras short lines deep meanings the kind of wisdom that can change the way you read a horoscope forever today lets explore 10 timeless sutras that every serious student of astrology should know read them slowlyeach one carries an entire chapter hidden inside it 1 a weak 7th house creates tired partnerships not failed relationshipstired ones emotional fatigue is the core 2 a strong lagnesh can rescue a weak chart selfmastery beats planetary weakness 3 ketu remembers what the mind has forgotten pastlife pull dj vu karmic connections 4 afflicted venus gives love without peace attachment high stability low 5 rahu gives instantly but returns nothing for free sudden results always come with a price 6 a wounded moon creates a restless heart mental health all yogas 7 mars in 7th loves passionately and fights passionately intensity is doubleedged 8 jupiter protects even when everything else collapses divine grace placement 9 saturn delays the weak but defines the strong delay denial 10 navamsa reveals who you truly become after 30 marriage maturity soulevolutionall start here astrology begins when memorising stops and understanding starts welcome to astrolearninghub a space for real learning and sincere seekers if you want a detailed interpretation of your chart based on these sutras inbox us serious seekers only

simple ways to give your uk home a fresh and stylish look your home is where comfort meets creativity its the place where you unwind after a long day share laughs with family and make lasting memories giving your home a fresh new look doesnt mean you have to spend a fortune with a few clever ideas you can create a space that feels cosy beautiful and truly yours lets explore some simple and stylish home dcor tips perfect for uk homes from colour choices to outdoor design ideas start with a soothing colour palette colour has the power to completely change the way a room feels in the uk where the weather can be cool and grey using the right shades can brighten your space and lift your mood soft neutrals like beige white and light grey create a calm and airy feel for a bit of charm add accents in pastel shades such as mint green blush pink or sky blue these tones bring a sense of peace while keeping your home light and cheerful if you prefer a modern touch consider adding contrast with navy or charcoal just a few accent pieces like cushions or an area rug can make your space look stylish and wellbalanced create a living room that feels inviting your living room should be a welcoming place for both guests and family focus on comfort first then add a touch of elegance through quality furniture and dcor a beautiful sofa a soft throw blanket and a mix of textures like linen velvet and wool can make your space feel cosy add warm lighting from lamps and candles to create a relaxing evening glow for furniture that combines craftsmanship and comfort explore barlowtyrie their timeless designs bring elegance and durability to your living room helping you build a stylish and functional space light up your home the right way lighting can change the mood of your home instantly instead of relying on one overhead light use multiple light sources throughout the room combine ceiling lights with wall sconces table lamps and floor lamps for a layered look warm light bulbs make rooms feel cosy while cooler tones suit areas like kitchens or workspaces adding candles or fairy lights can also make evenings more magical especially during dark uk winters give your bedroom a peaceful vibe your bedroom should feel calm and restful a place where you can recharge start with a clutterfree layout and choose soothing colours like light grey soft blue or cream invest in goodquality bedding and layer it with throws and cushions in different textures add a rug near your bed to keep your feet warm on chilly mornings for extra charm hang simple wall art or fairy lights for a cosy glow keeping the space tidy and personal helps you relax after a busy day mix textures for a cosy feel texture brings warmth and depth to your dcor combine materials like wood metal and fabric to create balance and interest for example you could pair a smooth wooden coffee table with a fluffy rug or add linen curtains beside a modern glass lamp mixing textures helps your home feel inviting not flat or plain this layering technique works well in every room from the kitchen to the hallway making your home feel more livedin and loved turn your outdoor space into a relaxing retreat even in the uks cool weather your outdoor space can become an extension of your home add comfortable furniture warm lighting and a few green plants to create an inviting atmosphere if youre looking for elegant designs that handle the british climate beautifully check out royal botania their outdoor furniture blends luxury with practicality helping you turn your garden terrace or balcony into a peaceful haven throw in some outdoor cushions blankets and lanterns and youll have the perfect spot for your morning coffee or weekend gettogether keep it organised and functional a tidy home always feels more comfortable make use of smart storage solutions to keep your belongings in order use stylish baskets shelving units and multipurpose furniture to keep clutter out of sight small touches like hooks trays and labelled boxes can make organisation both simple and attractive when everything has a place its easier to enjoy the beauty of your dcor and feel at peace in your surroundings add a touch of nature indoors bringing nature inside instantly makes your home feel fresher and more alive houseplants purify the air and add a pop of colour start with easytocarefor plants like peace lilies succulents or snake plants place them on shelves window sills or coffee tables to add life to dull corners if you dont have time for plant care faux plants can still give your home that natural look with zero effort make your garden a yearround destination your garden doesnt have to be limited to summer with the right setup you can enjoy it in every season consider adding stylish and weatherresistant furniture from 4 seasons outdoor their pieces are perfect for uk weather and designed to bring both comfort and sophistication to your outdoor space add outdoor lighting a fire pit and soft blankets for cooler evenings even a small patio or balcony can be turned into a beautiful place to relax and connect with nature add personal touches that reflect you a truly beautiful home reflects your personality decorate with items that tell your story travel souvenirs family photos handmade crafts or art pieces that inspire you mix modern dcor with vintage finds for a balanced and timeless look remember your home doesnt need to be pictureperfect it should feel like you a few personal details can make a huge difference turning your house into a space filled with warmth and meaning final thoughts decorating your home doesnt have to be complicated with a few creative ideas and quality pieces you can transform your space into something special whether youre upgrading your living room creating a cosy bedroom or designing a stylish outdoor area small changes can make a big impact by choosing trusted brands like barlowtyrie royal botania and 4 seasons outdoor you can bring lasting comfort beauty and elegance to every corner of your uk home make your home a place that feels warm inviting and full of life because you deserve to love where you live

i tested chatgpt atlas heres what i found when your browser becomes an ai copilot ive been testing chatgpt atlas openais new aipowered browser that aims to make browsing feel like working with an assistant instead of inside a browser its currently in early access macos only for now but after using it for a few days i have some clear takeaways both good and bad heres my breakdown the pros 1 clean modern interface atlas feels fast minimal and thoughtfully designed the ui looks more like a productivity workspace than a traditional browser the builtin chatgpt sidebar makes it easy to ask questions summarize pages or brainstorm ideas without switching tabs 2 ai context and memory one of the coolest parts atlas can remember what youve been researching it can reference past conversations or pages youve visited which is super useful for longterm projects writing or ongoing research its not perfect yet but the concept works 3 agent mode early preview this feature lets the ai actually do things like open tabs navigate websites and extract info its basically a lightweight version of an ai assistant that can browse for you for example 4 great for research and writing if you use ai for content creation learning or ideation atlas removes friction no more jumping between chatgpt google and docs it all happens in one space its surprisingly efficient the cons 1 macos only for now windows and mobile users are out of luck crossplatform versions are reportedly in development but theres no firm release date yet 2 stability and performance issues atlas feels like a beta product i experienced a couple of crashes and some heavy cpu usage during longer sessions usable but not yet daily driver reliable 3 security and privacy concerns since atlas uses an agent that can click and act on web pages theres a real risk of prompt injection malicious sites could try feeding commands to the ai also because it remembers your browsing context youll want to doublecheck what data is stored and where not ideal for anything involving sensitive information 4 no extension support yet atlas doesnt currently support browser extensions which makes it feel limited compared to chrome or other browsers if you rely on addons for productivity or workflow automation final thoughts atlas is an exciting step toward an ainative internet experience its not just ai inside your browser its a browser designed around ai that said its still early i wouldnt recommend it for handling confidential work or sensitive data yet but if youre curious about how ai could change the way we interact with the web its worth exploring let me know in the comments id love to hear your thoughts or see how others are using it link chatgpt atlas

welcome to rsupervisionunfiltered what this sub is and isnt welcome to rsupervisionunfiltered this cant be how supervision is supposed to work if youve ever had that thought once or a hundred times this space is for you if you had a great supervision experience congratulations truly but for many new counselors supervision becomes the place where harm starts not healing and too often the only options are 1 stay silent and survive 2 speak up and lose hours 3 walk away entirely this community was created to hold space for the fourth option tell the truth share your experience if your supervisor blurred boundaries you were gaslit with clinical language you felt like asking questions cost you safety you left or are still here carrying the harm quietly rarely is there a space where you dont have to defend your story here you dont have to explain why it hurt what this subreddit is a space to unpack supervision experiences honestly a place to witness and be witnessed without judgment a project thats part memoir part expos part survival guide what its not a place to name or shame individuals or agencies a subreddit for legal advice a vent board without purpose though venting is valid why your stories matter full disclosure this space supports a forthcoming nonfiction book about supervision and its impact on the profession some posts may be referenced but anonymized fictionalized or composited to explore themes and truths names locations and identifying info will not be used the goal is truth not exposure power not payback you dont have to share anything lurkers are welcome but if youre ready to speak what wasnt safe to say before this is your mic post freely comment with care be kind be real be respectful were glad youre here

can we recreate persistent wod larp using text and 3d space is there a way to get the realtime persistent character presence and unscripted chaos of a live action game larp without relying on physical space that shared sense of danger and immediate consequence is the one thing most traditional playbypost games cant deliver our play group decided to treat this as an experiment were using a visuallysupported 3d environment as our digital stage for a live textbased chronicle all running under the 20th anniversary edition v20 ruleset the goal is simple recreate the feeling of constant unscripted presence that defines larp allowing playerdriven interactions to happen spontaneously 247 across all timezones the experiment is currently focused on the red county subdomain of los angeles where our narrative is driven by a massive problem that demands realtime attention the blueberry anomaly this phenomenon is a persistent sundampening cloud over a small town its a terrifying everpresent masquerade breach that the local kindred are desperately trying to contain and investigate were exploring this crisis through a full crosssplat lens vampire mage fera etc right now our dedicated storytellers are focused on major plotlines for vampire fera and mage to explore the anomalys origins if youre interested in the logistics of creating a true online larp experience or if you have a theory on what wod phenomenon could cause a massive persistent sundampening cloud wed love to discuss the project and the lore further join the discussion and ongoing investigation here

blue lock oc qa kioshi answering some questions i was asked about kioshi 1 is he a talented learner or a genius i really think that these categories are more like a spectrum his main weapon which hes a genius at is his world class observational skills which leads to the secondary skill of adaptation trained however in every other regard hes a talented learner thinks things through with logic and precision and cant create nearly impossible goals like rin or shidou ps i dont think self style is exclusively genius and world style is exclusively tl i think the concept will be further explored in later chapters so as to fit someone like rin into it 2 whats his goal not really much of a goal at first he picked up soccer to prove a friend wrong who said he could never win the world cup and that was the spark his ego needed 3 what are his weapons ball control field iq and over all observation haki lol intuitively picked up metavision 4 whats his ego flow like its highly programming based its all based on variables and executing modules think isagis theories and snuffys tactics with ball precision nearing itoshi sae he can be a little slow to execute though the color of his flow is purplish black meant to represent the colors of outer space his true ego is actually based on this looking at the code for the fabric of reality but hes a little stubborn when it comes to considering what his intuition is telling him too stuck up in his own logic right now to evolve that way 5 whats the craziest goal he scored slide 5 for visual completely on accident he volleyed the ball and it hit the top then left pole before going in if you guys have any more questions feel free to ask d link to the original post

reason for this sub hello everyone lets be honest many of us feel the franchise is in a creative drought its been stuck in a cycle of safe choices confusing movie timelines and untapped potential but what if we stopped waiting this sub rtransformersreignited is our answer this is a community built for one purpose to keep the creative spirit of transformers alive this is your space to fork the source code take the core ideas transformation conflict identity and build your own worlds explore new genres tell the stories the mainline wont horror comedy romance philosophy its all welcome here expand the mythos explore eras before the war after it or ignore it completely create new characters and factions our goal isnt to get noticed by hasbro its to keep that original flame on the wonder of seeing a transformation for the first time the awe you felt when you saw your favorite character transform the excitement you felt when a new concept was introduced so post your art your fanfic your concepts the rules are in the sidebar to keep this a positive and legal space lets build something amazing together lets reignite the spark

lost the goodest boy yesterday tw traumatic loss our 1yr old rottweiler knuckles had a nasty habit of digging under the fence and exploring the area on multiple occasions it was a big game to him we would reinforce the fence put down bricks etc and he would find new ways to escape yesterday he got out when i was home alone with my 2 small kids didnt realize how long he had been gone i got a call from animal control that he had been hit by a car chasing a cat when i got there he was alive but i knew something wasnt right got him home to wait for someone to sit with my kids and about 10 minutes later he passed in my arms i have so much guilt and feel responsible i should have checked on him sooner and maybe could have stopped him from getting out my 5 year old had to witness everything and is still trying to grasp the fact knuckles is not coming back i keep repeating in my head the images of his last moments and have been crying basically nonstop he was the best dog he was great with our kids true to his name he was a big ol knucklehead and a colossal goof ball he was a 110lb lap dog with no sense of personal space i miss him so much
